intro: Descurainia cumingiana var. leiocarpa, commonly known as the smoothpod descurainia, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia, including China and Japan. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbage plants, and is characterized by its small, yellow flowers and linear leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, temperate environments and has a short life cycle, often completing its growth within a single growing season. Its seeds are enclosed in slender, smooth pods, which contribute to its common name and aid in seed dispersal.
